summary: The document is a confidential communication from the Chief of Station in Ciudad Trujillo to the Chief of WHD, dated 10 June 1958, detailing Mr. William Pawley's business interests in the Dominican Republic. These include investments in mineral exploitation, negotiations for purchasing the Hotel Hamaca in Boca Chica, and a concession for the procurement and worldwide sale of new Dominican postage stamps managed by his brother, Edward P. Pawley. The information regarding the postage stamps was provided by Mrs. Nora Britzius, an employee in the business.
key_findings: Mr. William Pawley had substantial investments in mineral exploitation in the Dominican Republic.
Negotiations were underway for Pawley to purchase the Hotel Hamaca in Boca Chica, near a new international airport.
A concession was granted to Pawley for the procurement and worldwide sale of new Dominican postage stamps, managed by his brother Edward P. Pawley.
The information source for the postage stamp concession was Mrs. Nora Britzius, an employee in the business.
